content.question: When the chemical reaction <math alttext="2 N O gas plus O 2 gas react to produce 2 N O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is carried out under certain conditions, the rate of disappearance of <math alttext="N O gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the negative 5 molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the rate of disappearance of <math alttext="O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> under the same conditions?

choices.label: Because two molecules of <math alttext="N O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are consumed per molecule of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate of disappearance of <math alttext="O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2.5 times 10 to the negative 5 molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Because two molecules of <math alttext="N O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are consumed per molecule of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate of disappearance of <math alttext="O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the negative 4 molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Because the rate depends on <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math>, the rate of disappearance of <math alttext="O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2.5 times 10 to the negative 9 molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Because the <math alttext="O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is under the same experimental conditions as <math alttext="N O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, it is consumed at the same rate of <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the negative 5 molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Because two molecules of <math alttext="N O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are consumed per molecule of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate of disappearance of <math alttext="O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2.5 times 10 to the negative 5 molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
